<div class="bothcols" key="publicbody"><p><u><em>Public Comment</em></u> is time reserved&nbsp;for citizens to speak on a matter that is not on the scheduled of the Meeting Agenda. Each person has 3 minutes to speak and must state their name and address for the record (<em>it is preferred that you fill out a Public Comment Form and return it to the City Recorder</em>). If there are multiple people from one Group/Entity that wish to convey "one message" they can have a Group Speaker and, upon request, would be given 5-10 minutes from Council to speak.</p>

<input name="agenda-item-unique" type="hidden" value="BC2NCK53886D">
<h2>Agenda Item Details</h2>
<div class="leftcol">Meeting</div>
<div class="rightcol">May 20, 2019 - AGENDA FOR COUNCIL MEETING</div>
<div class="leftcol">Category</div>
<div class="rightcol"><span class="agendanumber">5. </span>CONSENT AGENDA</div>
<div class="leftcol">Subject</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="ai-name"><span class="agendanumber">5.2 </span>OUTFITTING POLICE VEHICLES THROUGH LEHR-SALEM IN THE AMOUNT OF $43,779.59</div>
<div class="leftcol">Type</div>
<div class="rightcol">Action (Consent)</div>
<div class="leftcol">Recommended Action</div>
<div class="rightcol">- Move to authorize staff to execute an agreement for the outfitting of new patrol vehicles through LEHR-Salem in the amount of $43,779.59.</div>
<div class="leftcol">Goals</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="goals-viewer">
<a class="goal" unique="AW92ZV6FAC13"><div class="name">Goal #1 - Citizens feel safe and secure in their homes, work sites, and public places.</div></a>
<a class="goal" unique="AW934Y6FE44C"><div class="name">Goal #2 - Customer Service</div></a>
</div>
<br><br>
<div class="bothcols" key="publicbody"><p><u>REPORT GIVEN BY</u>: DAVE HENSLEE - CHIEF OF POLICE</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>ISSUE BEFORE COUNCIL</u>:&nbsp;<span style="line-height: normal;">Should Council approve the outfitting of new patrol vehicles to maintain an effective patrol fleet and maintain a seven-year vehicle rotation schedule?</span></p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>SUMMARY AND BACKGROUND</u>:</p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">For fiscal year 2018-2019, the Police Department was allocated $182,100 through budget approval for the purchase and outfitting of police vehicles.&nbsp;The purchase of four police vehicles for $140,621.04 from Northside Ford was approved by City Council and are currently on order.&nbsp;Four vendors were contacted (LEHR-Salem, Wireworks LLC, Emergency Responder Service Inc., and Day Wireless) regarding the outfitting of the patrol vehicles.&nbsp;LEHR-Salem was the low bidder at $43,779.59.</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;"><u>This amount is within the capital outlay for the total project costs illustrated below</u>.</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">Police Department CIP Budget: $182,100</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">Insurance Replacement: +$29,000</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">Purchase of Police Vehicles: -$140,621.04</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">Vehicle Outfitting (LEHR-Salem): -$43,779.59</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">Left over CIP funds: $26,669.37</span></p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>COUNCIL OPTION(S)</u>:</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">1.&nbsp; Approve vehicle outfitting through LEHR-Salem in the amount of $43,779.59.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">2.&nbsp; Deny vehicle outfitting and give new direction to staff.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>FINANCIAL IMPACT(S)</u>:</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">The fiscal year 2018-2019 General Fund Budget was approved with $182,100 allocated for Capital Outlay for police department vehicle purchasing and outfitting. Approval of this purchase is within the 2018-2019 CIP.&nbsp;The remaining amount in the CIP budget, after this purchase,&nbsp;allows the department to purchase a required computer, modem, and other equipment necessary for the police vehicles.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;"><u>STAFF’S RECOMMENDATION</u>: Council to approve Option 1.</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>AGENDA SENT TO</u>:</p>

<p>LEHR - Salem</p>

<p class="MsoNoSpacing">Wireworks&nbsp;LLC</p>

<p class="MsoNoSpacing">Emergency Responder Services, Inc.</p>

<p class="MsoNoSpacing">Day Wireless</p>

<p class="MsoNoSpacing">&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>DOCUMENT(S) ATTACHED</u>:</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">- Informal Solicitation Record w/Quotes for Vehicle Outfitting</p>

<p style="text-align: justify;">- Draft Contract</p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<h2>Agenda Item Details</h2>
<div class="leftcol">Meeting</div>
<div class="rightcol">May 20, 2019 - AGENDA FOR COUNCIL MEETING</div>
<div class="leftcol">Category</div>
<div class="rightcol"><span class="agendanumber">6. </span>LEGISLATIVE ACTIONS</div>
<div class="leftcol">Subject</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="ai-name"><span class="agendanumber">6.1 </span>MILITARY CONSTRUCTION COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT FOR REHABILITATION OF TAXIWAY G</div>
<div class="leftcol">Type</div>
<div class="rightcol">Action</div>
<div class="leftcol">Recommended Action</div>
<div class="rightcol">- Move to authorize staff to execute Military Construction Cooperative Agreement for Rehabilitation of Taxiway G.</div>
<div class="leftcol">Goals</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="goals-viewer">
<a class="goal" unique="AW93576FF269"><div class="name">Goal #3 - Economic Viability/Community Livability</div></a>
</div>
<br><br>
<div class="bothcols" key="publicbody"><p><u>REPORT GIVEN BY</u>:&nbsp;JOHN BARSALOU - AIRPORT DIRECTOR</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>ISSUE BEFORE COUNCIL</u>:&nbsp;Should the City accept approximately $158,286 in funding from the National Guard Bureau for the Rehabilitation of Taxiway G?</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>SUMMARY AND BACKGROUND</u>:</p>

<p>On May 6, 2019 City Council awarded a contract to Rocky Mountain Construction, LLC in the amount of $5,969,378 for the rehabilitation of Taxiway G.&nbsp;Total project costs, which include environmental, design, construction and construction administration, are estimated at $7,153,975.&nbsp;As a project funded under the FAA's Airport Improvement Project Program, 93.75% of the project ($6,706,850) will be funded by the FAA with the remaining 6.25% ($447,125) match requirement funded by the Airport.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>Part of the local match&nbsp;funding is a $150,000 State of Oregon Critical Oregon Airport Relief (COAR) grant obtained by the Airport.&nbsp;The 173rd Fighter Wing of the Oregon Air National Guard utilizes Taxiway G extensively in their daily operations and, as such, has offered $158,286.28 in funds through a Military Construction Cooperative Agreement (MCCA) for the project. The remaining approximately $138,839 of required match will be funded from budgeted Airport funds.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>COUNCIL OPTION(S)</u>:</p>

<ol>
	<li>Accept funds from Oregon Guard Bureau and execute MCCA.</li>
	<li>Decline funds from Oregon Guard Bureau.</li>
</ol>

<p><u>FINANCIAL IMPACT(S)</u>:</p>

<p>By accepting the MCCA funds, the&nbsp;Airport's obligation for matching funds&nbsp;will decrease from $297,125 to $138,838.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>STAFF’S RECOMMENDATION</u>:&nbsp; Council approval of Option 1.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>AGENDA SENT TO</u>:</p>

<p>173 CEF</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>DOCUMENT(S) ATTACHED</u>:</p>

<p>Military Construction Cooperative Agreement W-912JV-19-2-2165</p>
</div>

<input name="agenda-item-unique" type="hidden" value="BBSR8K5E7B63">
<h2>Agenda Item Details</h2>
<div class="leftcol">Meeting</div>
<div class="rightcol">May 20, 2019 - AGENDA FOR COUNCIL MEETING</div>
<div class="leftcol">Category</div>
<div class="rightcol"><span class="agendanumber">6. </span>LEGISLATIVE ACTIONS</div>
<div class="leftcol">Subject</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="ai-name"><span class="agendanumber">6.2 </span>ORDINANCE AMENDING KLAMATH FALLS CITY CODE SECTION 5.330 PERTAINING TO THE USE OF SLINGSHOTS AND AIR GUNS - First Reading</div>
<div class="leftcol">Type</div>
<div class="rightcol">Action</div>
<div class="leftcol">Recommended Action</div>
<div class="rightcol">- Move to introduce ordinance for first reading by title only.</div>
<div class="leftcol">Goals</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="goals-viewer">
<a class="goal" unique="AW934Y6FE44C"><div class="name">Goal #2 - Customer Service</div></a>
<a class="goal" unique="AW92ZV6FAC13"><div class="name">Goal #1 - Citizens feel safe and secure in their homes, work sites, and public places.</div></a>
</div>
<br><br>
<div class="bothcols" key="publicbody"><p><u>REPORT GIVEN BY</u>:&nbsp;MICHAEL SWANSON - CITY ATTORNEY</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>ISSUE BEFORE COUNCIL</u>: Should the Council amend Klamath Falls City Code Section 5.330 regarding the use of slingshots and air guns in the City?</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>SUMMARY AND BACKGROUND</u>:&nbsp;Currently, the City Code bans the use of any slingshot, slipper or air gun or similar device within the City.&nbsp; There is an exception if the person obtains a permit from the Chief of Police in order for the person to control vermin, rodents and other wild animals on private property within the City (please see Exhibit A).&nbsp;Over the last few years, several citizens have contacted Chief Henslee to obtain a permit to discharge air guns to deal with vermin.&nbsp; Because the permitting process is almost impossible to properly vet and enforce, the Chief has not issued any permits.&nbsp; Moreover, there are no specific methods to ensure the safe discharge of such instruments.&nbsp; By amending Code Section 5.330 in the manner proposed (please see Exhibit A), the Chief of Police will no longer be responsible to decide who receives a permit and who does not which relieves him from an impractical duty.&nbsp;Also, by limiting the missile flight to the property lines, the amended section places the responsibility of the safe operating of the instruments squarely upon the parties who are involved in using the item, namely the property owner and the shooter.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>COUNCIL OPTION(S)</u>:&nbsp;</p>

<p>1) Approve the proposed amendment to Code Section 5.330 and move to introduce the ordinance&nbsp;first reading by title only.&nbsp;</p>

<p>2) Modify the proposed amendment to Code Section 5.330 and instruct staff to prepare an ordinance which incorporates those modifications.</p>

<p>3) Not approve any amendments to Code Section 5.330.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>FINANCIAL IMPACT(S)</u>:&nbsp;There are no anticipated financial impacts to the City.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>STAFF’S RECOMMENDATION</u>:&nbsp; Council to approve&nbsp;Option 1.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>AGENDA SENT TO</u>: N/A</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>DOCUMENT(S) ATTACHED</u>:</p>

<p>﻿- Exhibit -&nbsp;Notates the proposed code changes to Section 5.330 Slingshots, Slippers and Air Guns</p>

<p>- Proposed&nbsp;Ordinance</p>

<p>﻿</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>
</div>

<br><br><br>
<h2>Motion &amp; Voting</h2>

<input name="agenda-item-unique" type="hidden" value="BC5PKY5A84D7">
<h2>Agenda Item Details</h2>
<div class="leftcol">Meeting</div>
<div class="rightcol">May 20, 2019 - AGENDA FOR COUNCIL MEETING</div>
<div class="leftcol">Category</div>
<div class="rightcol"><span class="agendanumber">6. </span>LEGISLATIVE ACTIONS</div>
<div class="leftcol">Subject</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="ai-name"><span class="agendanumber">6.3 </span>CONSIDERATION OF MARIJUANA ADVISORY COMMITTEE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR FACILITY TYPES OTHER THAN RETAIL</div>
<div class="leftcol">Type</div>
<div class="rightcol">Action</div>
<div class="leftcol">Goals</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="goals-viewer">
<a class="goal" unique="AW93576FF269"><div class="name">Goal #3 - Economic Viability/Community Livability</div></a>
<a class="goal" unique="AW934Y6FE44C"><div class="name">Goal #2 - Customer Service</div></a>
</div>
<br><br>
<div class="bothcols" key="publicbody"><p><u>REPORT GIVEN BY</u>: JOE WALL - PLANNING MANAGER</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>ISSUE BEFORE COUNCIL</u>: Whether to adopt the findings and recommendations of the Marijuana Advisory Committee and move to introduce the ordinance for first reading by title only?</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>SUMMARY AND BACKGROUND</u>: Through the passage of City Measure 18-112, the prohibition of recreational marijuana sales and production was lifted within City limits and an advisory committee was formed to draft more permanent regulations and standards governing the industry. The Mayor, with Council concurrence, appointed seven members to the newly established Marijuana Advisory Committee which has met regularly with findings prepared to date presented to City Council at a May 6, 2019, work session meeting. The Committee proposes changes to current regulating Code and ordinances (Ordinance No. 18-11 attached to this agenda report) as follows for Council consideration. While proposed revisions are summarized below, the drafted ordinance incorporating all recommended changes has been attached to the agenda report. Notedly, the Committee does not presently propose any change to the existing standards governing retail marijuana facilities, with the exception of, the addition of a 50-foot buffer from the Downtown Business Overlay Zone applicable for all facility types.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>Summary of ordinance changes for non-retail marijuana facilities</u>,</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>1. Elimination of the requirement that non-retail marijuana facilities be located <span data-grammar-rule="METRIC_UNITS_EN_US" data-grayt-phrase="1000 feet" data-wsc-lang="en_US" style="margin: 0px; box-sizing: content-box;">1,000 feet</span> from real property comprising a school attended primarily by minors, public library, park, recreation center or facility, licensed child care facility, public transit center, or game <span data-grammar-rule="PUNCTUATION_PARAGRAPH_END" data-grayt-phrase="arcades" data-wsc-lang="en_US" style="margin: 0px; box-sizing: content-box;">arcade where admission id not restricted to persons aged 21 years or older.</span></p>

<p>2. Elimination of the requirement that non-retail marijuana facilities be located at least <span data-grammar-rule="METRIC_UNITS_EN_US" data-grayt-phrase="1000 feet" data-wsc-lang="en_US" style="margin: 0px; box-sizing: content-box;">1,000 feet</span> from one another.</p>

<p>3. Requirement that all marijuana facilities be located at least <span data-grammar-rule="METRIC_UNITS_EN_US" data-grayt-phrase="50 feet" data-wsc-lang="en_US" style="margin: 0px; box-sizing: content-box;">50 feet</span> from the Downtown Business <span data-grammar-rule="PUNCTUATION_PARAGRAPH_END" data-grayt-phrase="Overlay" data-wsc-lang="en_US" style="margin: 0px; box-sizing: content-box;">Overlay</span> Zone.</p>

<p>4. Requirement for non-retail marijuana facilities to have entrances and exits that are not visible from a school's property.</p>

<p>5. <span data-grammar-rule="AGREEMENT_SENT_START" data-grayt-phrase="Defines terms" data-wsc-lang="en_US" style="margin: 0px; box-sizing: content-box;">The addition of definitions, terms,</span> and phrases pertinent to marijuana <span data-grammar-rule="PUNCTUATION_PARAGRAPH_END" data-grayt-phrase="legislation" data-wsc-lang="en_US" style="margin: 0px; box-sizing: content-box;">legislation</span>.</p>

<p>6. The addition of non-substantial technical changes.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>Broadly, the Committee has studied and recommended differentiating marijuana facility types with different standards applicable to non-retail facilities which are viewed as less impactful and are not open to the general public. The Committee has chosen at this time to not recommend any changes to the standards governing retail facilities except as noted as further consideration is needed based on Council feedback received during the work session meeting. Proposed amendments regarding retail facilities will be presented to Council at a future date with a nearer term meeting targeted.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>COUNCIL OPTION(S)</u>:</p>

<p>1) Adopt the recommendations of the Marijuana Advisory Committee, and move to introduce the ordinance for first reading by title only.</p>

<p>2) Amend the recommendations of the Marijuana Advisory Committee, and move to introduce the modified ordinance for first reading by title only.</p>

<p>3) Deny the recommendations of the Marijuana Advisory Committee, and provide staff and the Committee further direction to proceed.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>FINANCIAL IMPACT(S)</u>: There is no direct anticipated financial impact to the City.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>STAFF’S RECOMMENDATION</u>: Directional only, for Council's determination.&nbsp;</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>AGENDA SENT TO</u>:</p>

<p>- MJ Advisory Committee</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>DOCUMENT(S) ATTACHED</u>:</p>

<ul>
	<li>Committee Draft Ordinance</li>
	<li>Marijuana Fact Sheet</li>
	<li>Map Visuals (4)&nbsp;(included maps for all business types and available areas for ease of reference) Explanation to be&nbsp;provided by the Planning Manager.</li>
	<li>Ordinance No. 18-11</li>
</ul>
</div>

<h2>Agenda Item Details</h2>
<div class="leftcol">Meeting</div>
<div class="rightcol">May 20, 2019 - AGENDA FOR COUNCIL MEETING</div>
<div class="leftcol">Category</div>
<div class="rightcol"><span class="agendanumber">8. </span>COUNCIL TO ADJOURN AND RECONVENE AS URBAN RENEWAL AGENCY</div>
<div class="leftcol">Subject</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="ai-name"><span class="agendanumber">8.1 </span>APPROVE $50,000 PAYMENT TO ARGO KLAMATH TWO LLC FOR WORK TO THE OLD SKIPPERS BUILDING</div>
<div class="leftcol">Type</div>
<div class="rightcol">Action</div>
<div class="leftcol">Goals</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="goals-viewer">
<a class="goal" unique="AW93576FF269"><div class="name">Goal #3 - Economic Viability/Community Livability</div></a>
</div>
<br><br>
<div class="bothcols" key="publicbody"><p><u>REPORT GIVEN BY</u>: NATHAN CHERPESKI - CITY MANAGER</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>ISSUE BEFORE COUNCIL</u>: Should the City Council, acting in capacity as the Urban Renewal Agency, approve a $50,000 payment, per the terms of the Development Agreement, for work done to make the Old Skippers building reusable?</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>SUMMARY AND BACKGROUND</u>:&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;"><span>On October 3, 2005, the City Council enacted Ordinance No. 05-13 adopting the Klamath Falls Town Center Urban Renewal Plan ("Plan"). The purpose of the Plan was to support the redevelopment and rehabilitation of a 23.5-acre property located at the northwest corner of Avalon Way and Pershing Way formerly known as the "Shasta Mall," along with adjacent property to the north, formerly occupied by Sherm's Thunderbird and the 2.5-acre undeveloped parcel east of the former Shasta Mall adjacent to Austin Street ("Property").&nbsp; The total maximum indebtedness was set at $2,550,000.&nbsp; </span></span></p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;"><span>Significant work was undertaken from 2006 to 2007 with demolition of the old Sherm’s property and repair work in the parking area.&nbsp; About $1,400,000 was invested at that time. The developer then went into a bankruptcy and the property was purchased by new developers, Argonaut (Argo Klamath Two, LLC), in 2012.&nbsp; </span></span></p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;"><span>In June 2014, the City of Klamath Falls Urban Renewal Agency entered into a new development agreement with Argonaut for the remainder of the tax increment funds.&nbsp; In mutual discussions, the Agency and developer agreed to 3 project milestones for the release of funds for the final redevelopment.&nbsp; Milestone 1, allowed for up to $300,000 and was completed with the new signs and the opening of Bealls.&nbsp;Milestone 2, involved $200,000, with additional work in the old Gottshalks building and the opening of Sportsman’s Warehouse and demolition of the Skippers site.&nbsp;While the original intent was to demolish the Skippers building, Council amended the agreement in 2017 to allow for remodel and reuse of the building.&nbsp;There is a remaining $50,000 from Milestone 2 available to the developer at this time.&nbsp;Milestone 3, dedicates $603,000 to the redevelopment of the old Sherm’s site and has not been accessed.</span></span></p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0pt;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin-bottom: 0pt;">With the opening of Nine Thai Restaurant, Argo Klamath Two, LLC has met the terms of the development agreement to remodel or demolish the Skippers site.&nbsp;The Developer has requested the $50,000 remaining for Milestone 2.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>Urban Renewal Agency OPTION(S)</u>:</p>

<p>1. Authorize staff to release a payment of $50,000 to Argo Klamath Two, LLC for completion of Milestone 2 of the Development Agreement.</p>

<p>2. Decline to act at this time and provide staff further direction.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>FINANCIAL IMPACT(S)</u>:</p>

<p>Sufficient resources exist in the Town Center URA to make this payment from the Urban Renewal Fund. There is no impact to the City's General Fund.&nbsp;</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>STAFF’S RECOMMENDATION</u>: Urban Renewal Agency to Approve Option 1.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>AGENDA SENT TO</u>: N/A</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>DOCUMENT(S) ATTACHED</u>:</p>

<p>- Request and Backup Project Information</p>

If there are multiple people from one Group/Entity that wish to convey "one message" they can have a Group Speaker and, upon request, would be given 5-10 minutes from Council to speak.</p>

<h2>Agenda Item Details</h2>
<div class="leftcol">Meeting</div>
<div class="rightcol">May 06, 2019 - AGENDA FOR COUNCIL MEETING</div>
<div class="leftcol">Category</div>
<div class="rightcol"><span class="agendanumber">4. </span>CONSENT AGENDA</div>
<div class="leftcol">Subject</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="ai-name"><span class="agendanumber">4.2 </span>CONTRACT CHANGE ORDER #3 WITH J.W FOWLER GENERAL CONTRACTORS FOR THE PELICAN CITY BOOSTER STATION PROJECT PHASE III IN THE AMOUNT OF $34,004.30</div>
<div class="leftcol">Type</div>
<div class="rightcol">Action (Consent)</div>
<div class="leftcol">Recommended Action</div>
<div class="rightcol">- Move to authorize staff to execute Change Order #3 with J.W. Fowler General Contractors for the Pelican City Booster Station Project (Phase III) in the amount of $34,004.30.</div>
<div class="leftcol">Goals</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="goals-viewer">
<a class="goal" unique="AW93576FF269"><div class="name">Goal #3 - Economic Viability/Community Livability</div></a>
</div>
<br><br>
<div class="bothcols" key="publicbody"><p><u>REPORT GIVEN BY</u>:&nbsp;ANDREW LAKEY – ASSOCIATE ENGINEER/PROJECT MANAGER</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>ISSUE BEFORE COUNCIL</u>:&nbsp;Should the City authorize Change Order #3 with J.W. Fowler General Contractors for the Pelican City Booster Station Project (Phase III) in the amount of $34,004.30?</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>SUMMARY AND BACKGROUND</u>:</p>

<p>In August 2018, City Council authorized a contract with J.W. Fowler General Contractors for the Pelican City Booster Station Phase III Water Main Project. Construction work commenced on September 13, 2018. The major components of this project consist of a booster pump station, water main piping from the booster station on Lakeport Boulevard to Dan O’Brien Way, and a directional bore and casing under the railroad tracks and Hwy 97 – see attached vicinity map exhibit.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>During the design phase of this project, the design team and staff determined that the City would provide the Remote Telemetry Unit Panel (RTU Panel) and programming for this project and the Contractor would install the panel in the Booster Pump Station. The RTU Panel is the brain of the pump station which houses the pump controllers and necessary hardware to communicate with the City's&nbsp;SCADA system. Due to the timing of construction and City staff obligations, the project team asked J.W. Fowler to provide the RTU panel. Change Order #03 captures the additional time, equipment and materials needed to provide the required RTU Panel for this project.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>COUNCIL OPTION(S)</u>:</p>

<ol>
	<li>Approve staff to execute Change Order #3 with J.W. Fowler General Contractors for the Pelican City Booster Station Project Phase III in the amount of $34,004.30.</li>
	<li>Deny&nbsp;the execution&nbsp;of Change Order #3&nbsp;and advise staff how to proceed with purchase of the required equipment.</li>
</ol>

<p><u>FINANCIAL IMPACT(S)</u>:</p>

<p>Council awarded a Construction Services Contract with J.W. Fowler General Contractors in the amount of $1,552,923 and authorized a project contingency amount of $310,585. To date, including Change Orders #1, #2 and #3, a total contingency amount of $70,728.71 has received support by staff. Approval of Change Order #3 would result in a remaining contingency allowance of $239,856.29. The project is roughly 85% complete and further potential change orders should be minimal through project closeout.</p>

<ol>
	<li>Approval of Option 1 would utilize available funds allocated for this project.</li>
	<li>Approval of Option 2 would preserve funds within the budget, but not provide for a complete project unless alternative equipment purchase directive is received.</li>
</ol>

<p><u>STAFF’S RECOMMENDATION</u>: Council to approve Option 1.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>AGENDA SENT TO</u>:</p>

<p>- J. W. Fowler General Contractors</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>DOCUMENT(S) ATTACHED</u>:</p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">- Change Order Request #3</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">- PCO-08 (JWF NOC #07) – Potential Change Order Supporting Documents</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">- Change Order Log</span></p>

<p style="text-align: justify; margin-bottom: 0pt;"><span style="line-height: normal;">- Project Vicinity Map</span></p>
</div>

<a class="public-file" target="_blank" order="00001" unique="BBKULL77BF66" href="/or/cokf/Board.nsf/files/BBKULL77BF66/$file/267717%20CH03%20RTU%20Panel.pdf">267717 CH03 RTU Panel.pdf (203 KB)</a><a class="public-file" target="_blank" order="00002" unique="BBKUME77C5D4" href="/or/cokf/Board.nsf/files/BBKUME77C5D4/$file/Klamath%20Fall%20-Pelican%20Booster%20PS-NOC%20%237%20-%20RTU%20Panel%20%26%20associated%20equipment_Combined.pdf">Klamath Fall -Pelican Booster PS-NOC #7 - RTU Panel &amp; associated equipment_Combined.pdf (4,410 KB)</a><a class="public-file" target="_blank" order="00003" unique="BBKUML77D1B2" href="/or/cokf/Board.nsf/files/BBKUML77D1B2/$file/267717%20CO%20Log.pdf">267717 CO Log.pdf (147 KB)</a><a class="public-file" target="_blank" order="00004" unique="BBKUMP77E1D9" href="/or/cokf/Board.nsf/files/BBKUMP77E1D9/$file/Pelican%20Booster%20WM%20Layout.pdf">Pelican Booster WM Layout.pdf (1,095 KB)</a></div>

<h2>Agenda Item Details</h2>
<div class="leftcol">Meeting</div>
<div class="rightcol">May 06, 2019 - AGENDA FOR COUNCIL MEETING</div>
<div class="leftcol">Category</div>
<div class="rightcol"><span class="agendanumber">5. </span>LAND USE PUBLIC HEARING - QUASI JUDICIAL</div>
<div class="leftcol">Subject</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="ai-name"><span class="agendanumber">5.1 </span>A SPECIAL ORDINANCE ANNEXING A 0.40 ACRE PARCEL OF LAND LOCATED AT 2226 WASHBURN WAY - First Reading</div>
<div class="leftcol">Type</div>
<div class="rightcol">Action</div>
<div class="leftcol">Goals</div>
<div class="rightcol" id="goals-viewer">
<a class="goal" unique="AW934Y6FE44C"><div class="name">Goal #2 - Customer Service</div></a>
<a class="goal" unique="AW93576FF269"><div class="name">Goal #3 - Economic Viability/Community Livability</div></a>
</div>
<br><br>
<div class="bothcols" key="publicbody"><p><u>REPORT GIVEN BY</u>: JOE WALL - PLANNING MANAGER</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>ISSUE BEFORE COUNCIL</u>:&nbsp;Should City Council annex approximately a 0.40-acre parcel, located at 2226 Washburn Way, on the west side of Washburn Way, north of Cosby Avenue and south of S. 6th Street?</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>SUMMARY AND BACKGROUND</u>:</p>

<p>The applicant, Zimel &amp; Associates, proposes to bring the remaining .40-acre portion of a parcel into City limits to facilitate certain development types and uses. The southern portion of the parcel, which is roughly equivalent size, is already within City limits. It is very rare to have a single parcel with two separate jurisdictions. The subject property is surrounded by City limits on 3 of 4 sides.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>The address of the subject property is 2226 Washburn Way and the property can be further&nbsp;referenced&nbsp;as Map/Tax Lot R-3909-004AD-00900-000.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>The portion of the property outside city limits is currently zoned General Commercial (CG), a Klamath County Land Development Code zoning designation. Per Community Development Ordinance (CDO) Section 13.140, properties annexed into the City shall be assigned City zoning per the Jurisdictional Zoning Comparison Chart contained in the CDO. The chart shows that properties zoned CG in the County should be zoned General Commercial (GC) upon annexation to the City. The requested annexation and zoning to be assigned will cause the entirety of the property to be within City limits and zoned GC.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>Use and build-out of the subject property will remain similar after annexation if approved. Any future commercial development proposed for the site will need to obtain Design Review approval and meet all current City development standards.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>On April 22, 2019, the Planning Commission held a public hearing and reviewed the annexation Review Criteria listed below and the proposed staff findings. The Planning Commission accepted staff’s findings and unanimously recommended approval of the requested annexation to City Council. A summary version of the April 22, 2019 Planning Commission meeting minutes are attached to this Agenda Report.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="line-height: normal;"><span style="page-break-after: avoid;"><span style="margin: 0px;">RELEVANT REVIEW CRITERIA, FACTS AND ANALYSIS:</span></span></span></u></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">T<span style="line-height: normal;"><span style="margin: 0px;">his proposal is being reviewed according to the provisions of the Klamath Falls Community Development Ordinance (CDO) (Chapters 10 to 14), specifically, </span><span style="margin: 0px;">Sections 13.105-13.150, regarding Annexation.</span></span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span style="line-height: normal;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Criterion:</span></u><span style="margin: 0px;"> The annexation conforms to the Comprehensive Plan.</span></span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><b><span style="margin: 0px;">The Annexation will not encroach upon agricultural ground.</span></b></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Response: </span></u><span style="margin: 0px;">This annexation will not encroach upon agricultural ground. The property is located along Washburn Way, a major commercial corridor. While there are some vacant commercial properties in the vicinity, most of the properties are developed with commercial uses. </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><b><span style="margin: 0px;">The annexation will not encroach upon forestland.</span></b></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Response:</span></u><span style="margin: 0px;"> This annexation will not encroach upon forestland. The property is located along Washburn Way, a major commercial corridor. While there are some vacant commercial properties in the vicinity, most of the properties are developed with commercial uses. </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span><b>The annexation will help conserve open space and protect natural resources.</b> </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Response:</span></u><span style="margin: 0px;"> The subject property is approximately 0.70 acres in total size. Approximately 50% of the parcel is within the city limits and zoned GC. The remainder of the property is currently outside of the city limits and zoned CG under Klamath County jurisdiction. </span><span style="margin: 0px;">Through the requested annexation and concurrent assignment of the GC zoning designation, the entirety of the subject property will be available for the kinds of development permitted within the GC zone in the City. </span><span style="margin: 0px;">The proposed annexation will help to facilitate the development of the remainder of the property, providing for in-fill development in an area with existing urban infrastructure which helps to conserve open space and natural resources by limiting sprawl. </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span><b>The annexation will not adversely affect the quality of the community’s air, water and land resources.</b> </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">R</span></u><u><span style="margin: 0px;">esponse:</span></u><span style="margin: 0px;"> As stated above, the proposed annexation will help to facilitate the development of the remainder of the property, providing for infill development in an area with existing urban infrastructure. Infill development with its increased density of development helps to protect the community’s air quality by reducing sprawl and vehicle miles traveled. It also helps to protect the community’s water and land resources by preserving rural, undeveloped lands in their natural state. </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span><b>The annexation will not endanger life or property from natural disasters or hazards.</b> </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Response:</span></u><span style="margin: 0px;"> The property is located in an area with existing commercial development. The land is flat, outside of any mapped floodplain, and not particularly prone to natural disasters of hazards. Any future development of the property will be reviewed for consistency with building codes and all other applicable regulations related to natural hazard mitigation. This annexation will not endanger life or property from natural disaster or hazards.</span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span><b>The annexation will help satisfy the citizen’s recreation needs.</b> </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span>Re</span><span style="margin: 0px;">sponse:</span></u><span style="margin: 0px;"> Not applicable. This property will neither enhance nor detract from citizens’ recreation needs.</span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span><b>The annexation will help satisfy the community’s housing need.</b> </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Response:</span></u> <span style="margin: 0px;">Through the requested annexation and concurrent assignment of the GC zoning designation, the entirety of the subject property will be available for the kinds of development permitted within the GC zone in the City. Permitted uses include a wide range of both commercial uses and residential densities/types. It is possible the property could be developed/redeveloped to meet a portion of the community’s housing needs.</span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span><b>The annexation will diversify and improve the community economy.</b> </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Response:</span></u> <span style="margin: 0px;">Through the requested annexation and concurrent assignment of the GC zoning designation, the entirety of the subject property will be available for the kinds of development permitted within the GC zone in the City. Permitted uses include a wide range of both commercial uses and residential densities/types. <span style="margin: 0px; -ms-layout-grid-mode: line;">Use and build-out of the subject property will remain similar after annexation if approved. </span></span><span style="margin: 0px;">Any future commercial development proposed for the site will need to obtain Design Review approval and meet all current City development standards. </span><span style="margin: 0px;">The proposed annexation will help to facilitate the development of the remainder of the property, providing for infill development in an area with existing urban infrastructure. </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span style="margin: 0px;">The requested annexation is supported by several goals and policies within the Economy element of the Comprehensive plan. These policies support diversifying and improving the local economy, supporting development that will help to assure the City of an adequate tax base, and a continued analysis and review of land use needs of the urban area. The requested annexation will aide in diversifying and improving the economy of the community.</span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span><b>The annexation will create a timely, orderly, and efficient arrangement of public facilities and services.</b> </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Response:</span></u><span style="margin: 0px;"> The property is located along Washburn Way, a major commercial corridor with existing public facilities and infrastructure. Notice of the proposed annexation was sent to public and private utility providers. Those agencies that responded presented no concerns related to the proposed annexation or the ability to provide service to the types of uses permitted in the GC zone.</span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><b><span style="margin: 0px;">The annexation will help provide a safe, convenient and economic transportation system. </span></b></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">R</span></u><u><span style="margin: 0px;">esponse:</span></u><span style="margin: 0px;"> The property is located along Washburn Way, a major commercial corridor. The proposed annexation is not anticipated to have any effect on the existing transportation system in the vicinity. </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span><b>The annexation will aid in conserving energy.</b> </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Response:</span></u> <span style="margin: 0px;">Through the requested annexation and concurrent assignment of the GC zoning designation, the entirety of the subject property will be available for the kinds of development permitted within the GC zone in the City. </span><span style="margin: 0px;">The proposed annexation will help to facilitate the development of the remainder of the property, providing for infill development in an area with existing urban infrastructure. The use of existing infrastructure and increased density that comes from infill development both help to conserve energy by limiting the amount of additional infrastructure that needs to be developed and by limiting vehicle miles traveled. </span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><b><span style="margin: 0px;">The annexation will promote an orderly and efficient transition from rural to urban land uses. </span></b></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span style="line-height: normal;"><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Response:</span></u><span style="margin: 0px;"> The requested annexation is supported by several goals and policies within the Urbanization element of the Comprehensive plan. The policies of the Urbanization element support the orderly transition from rural to urban uses, the utilization of lands within the Urban Growth Boundary (UGB) for urban development, and the promotion of infill development in areas with existing transportation infrastructure and utility services. The proposed annexation will help to facilitate the development of the remainder of the property, providing for infill development in an area with existing urban infrastructure. The proposed annexation is consistent with the policies of the Comprehensive Plan that encourage an orderly transition of properties within the UGB to urban development through annexation and appropriate development controls (through zoning).</span></span></p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><span style="line-height: normal;"><b><span style="margin: 0px;">City Surveyor Comments –</span></b></span></p>

<p>GENERAL INFORMATION &amp; FACTS: The property in question is shown as Assessor Map Reference 3909-04AD Tax Lot 900. The applicant is requesting annexation into the City Limits of Klamath Falls. The process requires review and approval by the City of Klamath Falls City Council and the Oregon Department of Revenue (DOR).</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>COMMENTS &amp; CONDITIONS</u>:</p>

<p>The proposed and approved boundary change shall comply with the City of Klamath Falls Community Development Ordinances/Codes, the Boundary Change Information requirements per the Oregon DOR, Oregon Revised Statute (ORS) 308.225 and any other conditions noted by the City of Klamath Falls Planning Division.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>The State of Oregon requires that a proposed and final approved boundary change shall be approved by City Council, being the appropriate boundary authority, through order, ordinance (per City of Klamath Falls), or resolution with required descriptions and maps.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>A boundary change description and map shall be prepared in accordance with ORS 308.225(2)(b). The City Surveyor requests that any description and map not prepared, signed and stamped by a Professional Land Surveyor licensed in the State of Oregon shall then be reviewed and approved by such Professional prior to forwarding to City Planning and the DOR. The applicant may also request the City Planning Manager to prepare those documents (description &amp; map), by the City Surveyor and City Engineering Division, at a not to exceed determined amount.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>A signed copy of the order, ordinance (per City of Klamath Falls), or resolution must be submitted to the DOR with the descriptions and maps for review and approval.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>There are three potential errors that may be found by the DOR in their review of the ordinance, description and map. Those are classified as; Typographical errors, Minor error and Major error. Note that, any boundary change information that has to be corrected for any reason requires a correcting order, ordinance, or resolution from the appropriate boundary authority (City of Klamath Falls Council).</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>As stated above under the City Surveyor Comments, there are certain steps that must be taken to insure the proposed annexation complies with the City of Klamath Falls Community Development Ordinances/Codes and the Boundary Change Information requirements per the Oregon Department of Revenue and Oregon Revised Statute (ORS) 308.225. By following the comments and conditions outlined by the City Surveyor, the applicant can insure the proposed annexation meets applicable standards for the City and the Oregon DOR.</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;">&nbsp;</p>

<p style="margin: 0px;"><b><u><span style="margin: 0px;">Proposed Finding:</span></u></b><span style="margin: 0px;"> <b>The annexation conforms to the Comprehensive Plan.</b> <b>This criterion is met with the conditions stated above under City Surveyor Comments.</b></span></p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>COUNCIL OPTION(S)</u>:</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><strong>Option 1 (approve as proposed):</strong><br>
a) Move to accept the proposed findings as presented by staff and recommended by Planning<br>
Commission.</p>

<p>b) Move to approve the requested annexation based on the accepted findings.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><strong>Option 2 (approve with modifications):</strong><br>
a) Move to modify the proposed findings to mitigate a concern (identify proposed modifications).<br>
b) Move to approve the requested annexation based on the modified findings.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><strong>Option 3 (denial):</strong><br>
a) Move to direct staff to modify the proposed findings to support denial of the proposed annexation<br>
and change of zone based on direction from the Council.</p>

<p>b) Move to deny the requested annexation based on the modified findings.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>FINANCIAL IMPACT(S)</u>:&nbsp;There is no financial impact.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>STAFF’S RECOMMENDATION</u>: Council to approve Option 1.</p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><u>AGENDA SENT TO</u>:</p>

<p><span style="margin: 0px;">Meridian, ID 83646</span></p>

<p>&nbsp;</p>

<p><span style="margin: 0px;">- <em>Collins Properties, LLC</em></span></p>
